document.discussion_title: Third edition of Texfusion attracts more than 1,000 visitors
document.topic_text: Print Third edition of Texfusion attracts more than 1,000 visitors April saw the third edition of leading UK textile fair Texfusion, which was held on Monday 18 and Tuesday 19 in Lindley Hall at the Royal Horticultural Halls in London. Texfusion Visited by more than 1,000 professionals and housing nearly 50 exhibitors from 14 countries, the trade show crowned itself as the major global textile sourcing fair in the UK. Many of the exhibitors were showing for the first time in the region and represented a variety of countries. Turkey, China, South Korea, India and Hong Kong showed the highest number of exhibitors.The 2-day event also recorded visitors from all over the world. Although 90% were British professionals, there was a consistent attendance from abroad, mainly from France, Belgium, Sweden, Spain, Italy, Austria and Germany. Visitors had the unique opportunity to source from a wide selection of: lycra, wool, viscose, denim, women/men dress fabrics, bridal fabrics, shirting, sportswear, kids wear fabrics, prints, lace and accessories.Texfusion is the international arm of The London Textile Fair, which is dedicated to European manufacturers. Due to its success, the trade show is moving to a bigger venue, the Business Design Centre in London’s Islington, for its next edition.
